metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16913 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The "stub_recv_cmd_submit()" function (drivers/usb/usbip/stub_rx.c) in theLinux Kernel before version 4.14.8, 4.9.71, and 4.4.114 when handlingCMD_SUBMIT packets allows attackers to cause a denial of service (arbitrarymemory allocation) via a specially crafted USB over IP packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16913` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1086-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1086.94
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1088-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1088.93
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1054.63
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1020.25
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-119.143').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
